channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Shrub areas need thorough litterpick along Westmoreland Rd, 24th January
item.description:
The shrub areas outlined on the photo (running from Woodlea Drive to Pickhurst Lane, behind bus stop) need attention for litter please. All three shrub areas need someone to go in and remove all litter and rubbish as unsightly litter can be seen from Westmoreland Rd. Please ensure this request is only marked as closed once the work has been completed. Issues are regularly closed before action has been taken, which leads to unnecessary re-reporting.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 147 - 151, Westmoreland Road, Park Langley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars Parking in Buckland Court, 24th January
item.description:
Cars have been illegally parking here for well over a year now (sometimes on the grass!). Compounding the problem is the fact that the pathway surface has gradually turned into mud in places and needs attention as it is very hazardous to walk on when wet.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Johns Estate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot hole and tram line across the road, 24th January
item.description:
The deep tram lines from one side of road to the other cause extensive noise of a night when cars going up and down road and lots of pot holes this has been getting worse over the past couple of years
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 150, Ramillies Road, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 24th January
item.description:
Fly tipping next to the litter bin. People stop their car and dump domestic rubbish next to this bin. This is illegal. The litter bin is beginning to become a real nuisance and I am having to report issues with this bin more and more often.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kelby Path, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rocking manhole, repair failed, 24th January
item.description:
I watched the repairmen fill the pothole with black stuff, and it worked for about a day. But pretty quickly started banging again. Seems like the stuff they poured just fell down the manhole. This needs a more permanent fix.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 86, London Road, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter, 24th January
item.description:
I’d like to report an incident of littering near the bus station. Two women were seen throwing trash on the ground instead of using the bins. Please look into this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 201/203, High Street, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking on double yellow lines during drop-off and pick-up, at school times., 24th January
item.description:
When the children are dropped-off and picked-up at school times, cars park on the double yellow lines that are over my mum's drive at number 14 Thornsbeach Road. There are double yellow lines over the drive, but they take no notice. They park and leave their cars for up to an hour sometimes - especially after school. The cars can't go down to Rushey Green School so they park over peoples drives, not just my mum's. They double park and park by the green on double yellow lines. My mum has dementia and we have appointments for the Doctors. We can't get off our drive because it is blocked. I'm always phoning Lewisham parking services for a ticket to be given.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thornsbeach Road, Catford South, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 Shopping Trolleys, 24th January
item.description:
There are 2 shopping trolleys on the pavement by the green. They have been there for over a week. They go and are soon replaced by more trolleys. It's a common occurrance. There are cctv signs on a tree, in exactly the same place, but the 3 signs, yes, 3 signs on a tree and the fence of the green, have no impact.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thornsbeach Road, Catford South, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
